comment.author: 62379908@N00
comment._content: I remember those days in Florida.  People from "up north" would pull trailers to Florida with their family car.  Then they would set up in a trailer park close to the beach and good fishing.  They often stayed all winter.  Some claimed it was cheaper  than staying home.  Yes, a 1950ish Buick, Chrysler, Packard, Lincoln, or Oldsmobile had the power to pull trailers like that.  "Up north." in Florida always meant somewhere between Macon Georgia and Hudson Bay.

comment.author: 31846825@N04
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/howard33] Thanks for the comment! If you’re interested in learning more about the "Tin Can Tourists" and other trailering enthusiasts, check out this photo exhibit on Florida Memory: floridamemory.com/photographiccollection/photo_exhibits/t....
comment.authorname: State Library and Archives of Florida
